facts.fact: On the Help! album sleeve the semaphore letters that the four Beatles are spelling out with their arms does not say H E L P, but N U J V.
‘Strawberry Fields’ refers to a Salvation Army home near to where John lived in Woolton, Liverpool, except that the place has no ‘s’ on the end; it is Strawberry Field.
The first Lennon & McCartney composition to top the UK singles chart by another artist was Billy J Kramer with the Dakotas’ Bad To Me in August 1963.

St. Peter's Church in Woolton holds a pivotal place in music history. It's where John Lennon met Paul McCartney in 1957, sparking their legendary songwriting partnership that led to the formation of The Beatles.
George Martin played keyboards on almost every Beatles album.
